case_title: RASOOL KHAN KHATTAK and others vs HAMID KHAN AFRIDI and another

accussed_details.name: Hamid Khan Afridi
allegation: Association with a gang involved in smuggling
Operating Kohat Bargain Centre with Ismail, Zahid Ullah, and Ghulfam
Taking money from both parties in litigation
Unbecoming conduct violating the Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973

complaint_summary: Joint complaint filed by Rasool Khan Khattak and Kazim Ali Bungash against Hamid Khan Afridi alleging misconduct, smuggling, forgery, and other unethical practices.
investigation_summary: Disciplinary Committee initiated proceedings; complainants sought withdrawal of complaint on 17-07-2001; withdrawal allowed with Rs. 5,000 cost imposed on each complainant.
judgment_summary: Appeals accepted; impugned order set aside; case remanded to Disciplinary Committee for decision on merits; withdrawal application rejected.
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded to Disciplinary Committee for decision on merits.
legal_arguments: Imposition of costs/fine is discretionary under Section 44 of Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973.
No provision for withdrawal of misconduct cases based on compromise.
Misconduct cases must reach logical conclusion either through punishment or exoneration.
statutes: Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973
sections: Section 44 of Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973
key_issues: Validity of withdrawal of complaint in misconduct cases
Jurisdiction of Disciplinary Committee to impose costs/fines
Legal framework for handling professional misconduct

maxims.Misconduct Allegations: Cannot be exonerated through compromise; must reach logical conclusion.

legal_terms.Professional Misconduct: Violation of prescribed canons of conduct for advocates.
legal_terms.Costs: Monetary penalty imposed on complainants for withdrawal of complaint.

words_and_phrases.Unbecoming Conduct: Behavior not befitting the professional standards of an advocate.
words_and_phrases.Frivolous Complaint: Complaint lacking serious intent or merit.

summary_vector_notes: Appeals filed against withdrawal of complaint in professional misconduct case. Disciplinary Committee's decision to impose costs challenged. Tribunal ruled withdrawal invalid under legal framework; remanded case for decision on merits.

allegations: Association with a gang involved in smuggling
Operating Kohat Bargain Centre with Ismail, Zahid Ullah, and Ghulfam
Taking money from both parties in litigation
Unbecoming conduct violating the Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973

withdrawal_request.outcome: Allowed with Rs. 5,000 cost on each complainant

impugned_order.grounds: Illegal imposition of costs/fine, lack of jurisdiction

legal_analysis.section_44_reference: Legal Practitioner and Bar Councils Act, 1973

precedents.case: Muhammad Amir v. M. Asghar Kokar Advocate
precedents.principle: Misconduct cases cannot be withdrawn or compromised.

precedents.case: Irshad Khan v. Gohar Rehman Khattak Advocate
Wajid Ali v. Zafar Khalil Advocate
Ali Rehman v. Zaheeruddin Baber Advocate

decision.directive: Parties to appear before the Disciplinary Committee for decision on merits
